title: 第一章 不要燒我！
content:
Zhou Ze splashed some water on his face and slowly raised his head, looking at his reflection in the mirror. He appeared a bit haggard. As an emergency room doctor, this haggardness seemed like a standard feature.

"Dr. Zhou, a new patient is arriving soon. They seem to have fallen from upstairs, possibly a suicide!" Nurse Wang Ya called from the doorway of the men's restroom.

"Got it, coming right out," Zhou Ze replied, then grabbed some paper towels to dry off the water and walked out.

The ambulance soon pulled into the hospital. Lying on the stretcher was an elderly man in a grey Tang suit. He was coughing incessantly, expelling bloody phlegm and fragments of his spleen, his entire body covered in bloodstains.

Zhou Ze rushed over, pushing the stretcher while assessing the patient's condition. He yelled ahead, "Prepare surgical instruments, quickly!"

The patient's condition was very poor.

"I... I... don't want to die."

The old man's eyes were open, looking at Zhou Ze, the closest person to him.

"Don't worry, you'll be alright. We'll help you. You won't die."

Most critically ill patients would say such things at this point; truly calm individuals facing death were a rarity. As a doctor, this was not the time to analyze the patient's prognosis and state their chances of survival. What the patient needed at this moment was psychological comfort.

"No... no... down there... down there... down there is really too terrifying..."

The old man suddenly gripped Zhou Ze's wrist, looking at him with a serious expression.

"Calm yourself, relax. Your life is not in danger." Although his wrist felt a bit sore, Zhou Ze did not try to pull away.

"I don't want... don't want to go down anymore... they... they found me... I... they found me..."

"Hiss..." Zhou Ze suddenly felt a sharp pain in his wrist.

"Dr. Zhou, your hand!" the young nurse beside him exclaimed.

The old man's fingernails were long and, for some reason, black. They were a transparent black, like amber, not appearing to be darkened by dirt. At this moment, the old man's nails had dug into the flesh of Zhou Ze's wrist.

"I'm not going down... not going down... not going down... haha... cough cough cough..."

The old man suddenly sat up, coughing violently. Then, his body trembled, the hand that was gripping Zhou Ze's wrist fell away, and he became still.

"Prepare for resuscitation!" Zhou Ze shouted.

The old man was pushed into the emergency room. Doctors and nurses began resuscitation measures, and the defibrillator was readied.

"Dr. Zhou, I'll help you with your wound," Wang Ya said, walking over.

As doctors, they weren't particularly worried about this minor flesh wound. Their primary concern was the possibility that the old man might have other illnesses that could put them at risk of occupational exposure. After all, there had been a lot of blood on his hands, and no one knew if he had any contagious diseases. Some illnesses, once contracted, could ruin a person's life.

After the wound was bandaged, another doctor emerged from the emergency room and shook his head at Zhou Ze. This meant the patient had not been saved. Everyone felt a bit dejected, but for them, this was a common occurrence, and they would quickly adjust.

"Dr. Zhou, you should get a check-up," Wang Ya suggested.

"No, I have some things to attend to tonight," Zhou Ze replied, shaking his head. He went straight to the locker room to change his clothes, then drove his car from the hospital parking lot.

As his car passed under the Jianghai Avenue overpass, Zhou Ze's phone rang.

"Hello, this is Zhou Ze."

"Dr. Zhou, the children are all waiting for you."

"I'm sorry, Principal Wu. A patient caused a delay. I'll be there immediately. Please ask the children to wait a little longer."

"Okay, okay." The call ended quickly.

Zhou Ze glanced at his watch; it was already 8:30 PM. The children at the orphanage usually went to bed very early.

The red light turned green, and Zhou Ze stepped on the accelerator.

"HONNNNNNNNNNNNNK!!!!"

Just then, a heavy truck ran through the red light. Zhou Ze only had time to turn his head towards the blinding high beams outside his car window.

Then,

"CRASH!"

The world spun. His small car, in front of the heavy truck, was like a fragile piece of paper, instantly flung out, tumbling several times in the air before crashing to the ground.

...

"Ugh..."

Zhou Ze regained consciousness.

He found he couldn't move his body at all, as if he were trapped. At the same time, his eyes wouldn't open. He knew he had been in a serious car accident. Out of professional habit, he wanted to check his injuries right away, but he couldn't move.

Around him, he could intermittently hear the sounds of other vehicles passing by, along with various horns. *Am I still at the accident scene? Am I still in the car?* Zhou Ze thought to himself.

Soon, the sirens of police cars could be heard, followed by the sound of fire trucks. Finally, he heard the familiar wail of an ambulance siren. Zhou Ze sensed his body being moved. The temperature around him was slightly higher; they were probably cutting open his car to rescue him. Zhou Ze had participated in many such rescue operations and was familiar with some of the procedures. *What a shame. The cake in my trunk, and the orphanage children's Children's Day party, will have to be canceled.*

"Dr. Zhou!"

A familiar voice. It should be Dr. Chen from the hospital. Zhou Ze let out a sigh of relief in his heart. At least he had saved his life. This could be considered a bolt from the blue. He could hear the voices of a few nurses nearby, but due to the noise, Zhou Ze couldn't quite make them out.

However, what Dr. Chen said next sent Zhou Ze's heart plummeting into the abyss!

"Dr. Zhou has lost vital signs."

*No,*

*I'm not dead!*

*I'm not dead yet!*

*I'm not dead!!*

Zhou Ze screamed desperately in his mind! He wasn't dead; he still had consciousness. He wasn't dead!

Next, Zhou Ze felt someone performing CPR on him. He felt the heavy compressions each time, but he couldn't open his eyes or speak. He wasn't dead. He hoped they would realize he wasn't dead soon!

But after a period of frantic activity, Zhou Ze heard the crying of a few nurses he recognized. Dr. Chen punched a nearby car door, appearing grief-stricken. *Hey! Don't give up! Please don't give up! I'm not dead! I must be in a state of suspended animation. Excessive blood loss? Serious injuries? But I'm truly not dead! I should still be breathing; I should still have a heartbeat!* Zhou Ze roared inwardly.

But then, he sensed himself being lifted onto a stretcher, presumably being put into an ambulance. Following that was the sound of the ambulance driving away. The nurses in the carriage were still crying. But these cries were particularly jarring to Zhou Ze's ears. He wasn't dead. Why were they crying! Why were they crying! Look at me again, check again, I'm not dead!

The ambulance stopped. Immediately, Zhou Ze heard the hospital leadership speaking.

"Little Zhou is gone just like that?"

"The car accident was very severe. Dr. Zhou suffered excessive injuries and blood loss. He has been confirmed dead."

"Really? He's gone just like that?" another vice president disbelieved.

"Little Zhou is gone," came the voice of a department director. "I just checked him again."

*I'm not dead!*

*You quacks!*

*I'm not dead!*

*You bastards!*

*Bastards!*

Zhou Ze cursed inwardly. At this moment, the people around him were no longer his colleagues, friends, leaders, or elders. They actually believed he was dead. But could dead people hear and perceive? *I'm not dead! You bastards, you beasts, I'm not dead! Save me! Save me!*

The stretcher began to be pushed along. The surroundings were quiet, and the temperature was gradually decreasing.

"Xiao Ya, don't be too sad. The hospital director said there will be a memorial service for Dr. Zhou tomorrow."

"Sister Suqin, I just can't believe it. A person is just gone like that. Dr. Zhou was such a good person. How could he be gone like this?"

"The weather is unpredictable, and fortunes change. Just try to accept it."

After the two nurses finished speaking, they left. The surroundings were empty. That chilling coldness was so clear. Zhou Ze struggled and struggled, wanting to resist, wanting to wake up, desperately wanting to make a sound. But his current feeling was like being sleep-paralyzed; no matter how hard he tried, his body wouldn't obey him. Finally, he gave up in despair. He was tired, exhausted. He knew where he was: in the hospital's morgue.

...

When Zhou Ze "woke up" again, he sensed a faint coolness on his face, and a stinging sensation was also clear.

"Is the makeup ready?" someone asked from nearby.

"Don't rush. He's been smashed to pieces like that; makeup isn't that quick."

"The hospital is urging us to send him to the memorial service."

"Why don't you come and do it?"

The mortician seemed annoyed and applied more pressure while doing the makeup. Of course, their clients were dead, and the dead wouldn't feel pain or complain, so they only needed to show results to the living. Zhou Ze had no strength left to struggle. He lay there quietly, enduring the stinging sensation of the makeup brushes pressing down on his face. Finally, the makeup was finished.

"Alright, call them in. Our work is done."

Zhou Ze felt his clothes being changed. Then, he was pushed out. The hospital attendant placed him into a soft, cramped space. This, he figured, must be a refrigerated coffin. Then, all the noise around him was instantly isolated. The lid must have been closed.

Shaking, swaying, jolting...

After an unknown amount of time, Zhou Ze finally heard sounds again. The lid of the refrigerated coffin must have been opened. What met his ears was funeral music. The hospital director was speaking into a microphone, praising him, lamenting him. Then came the vice president and other directors. Around him, he heard footsteps passing by. Some people walked past quietly, taking one last look at him. Some even tried to call out to him, their voices choked with tears. This was viewing the body. Viewing *my* body! *I'm not dead, I'm really not dead, I'm not dead yet! I'm not dead!* Zhou Ze cried out in his heart. He started trying again, but he still couldn't. He could only hear and feel, but he couldn't speak or open his eyes. Everyone believed he was dead, but he knew for himself that he wasn't dead yet! The children from the orphanage had also arrived and were crying beside him. They cried sincerely because Zhou Ze himself was a child from an orphanage. Consequently, after he started working, most of his salary was donated to the orphanage. He had been in a car accident because he was rushing back to the orphanage to spend Children's Day with the children.

"Little Zhou, rest in peace. You died in the line of duty this time. You have no family, but the hospital will give your compensation to the orphanage. Don't worry." The vice president stood beside Zhou Ze and said this.

Subsequently, Zhou Ze felt himself being isolated again. The lid of the refrigerated coffin must have been closed once more. Then came another series of jolts, and finally, it stopped. The lid of the refrigerated coffin was opened again. The surroundings were quiet, with occasional human voices, but not noisy. Two people, one holding his shoulders and the other holding his legs, lifted him up and placed him onto another cold shelf, which seemed to be made of steel plate. These two people were very skilled, extremely skilled. Faint cries could be heard around him. At first, Zhou Ze couldn't figure out where he had arrived, but at this moment, he suddenly understood. *Bastards! They've sent me to the crematorium! They're going to burn me! I'm not dead, you bastards! Damn your ancestors! I'm not dead! I'm not dead yet! Don't cremate me, don't cremate me! I'm truly not dead yet!!!!!!!!!!!! You beasts, you mongrels! You sons of bitches!!!!!* This was Zhou Ze's most furious and most frenzied moment. He knew that once he was cremated, there would be no turning back! He would directly face death! Complete annihilation! He was unwilling, truly unwilling. He was not yet thirty years old, not yet married, had no children, still had his life, and still had a long way to go!

"Mom, I just saw this uncle's hand move," a little girl's timid voice sounded from nearby.

"Slap!" A small slap landed.

"Don't talk nonsense. I'll deal with you when we get home," the girl's mother scolded.

Zhou Ze despaired because no matter how much he struggled, no matter how much he roared in his mind, the people outside could not perceive it. He was placed on a conveyor belt. The machine started, and he was being pushed forward. He knew what he was about to face, and because of that, he was terrified!

No, no, no! I'm not dead, I'm truly not dead! Don't burn me! Don't burn me! No one could hear his calls. They were only responsible for being sad, for being sorrowful, for completing this process, and then going home for dinner and continuing their lives tomorrow. Finally, Zhou Ze sensed that he had been pushed into a narrow space with a smell of burnt oil. Immediately, a sticky liquid was sprayed on him. He knew what it was: gasoline. Then, "Ssss..." Hot! Very hot! Pain, intense burning pain! Fire, fire, a conflagration, fire everywhere...

title: 第二章 地獄！
content:
冷，



  好冷……



  周澤不知道為什麼這裡會這麼冷，



  他行走在一條幽徑的小路上，小路的兩邊，開滿了鮮花，卻沒有絲毫浪漫美好的氣息，花朵嬌艷，像是一道道嘲諷，也像是圍觀的看客。



  花開彼岸，人去往生；



  周澤記得自己之前最後的記憶是火，大火，恐怖的火焰將自己完全吞噬，那令人心悸的炙熱溫度將自己烘烤成灰。



  但轉眼間，



  他卻來到了這裡。



  在這條路上，其實還有許多人，



  有老人，



  有孩子，



  也有年輕人和中年人，



  有男有女，



  大家穿的衣服各不相同。



  有的人穿得很簡單，有的人穿著大紅大紫的衣服，臉上也畫著過分的腮紅。



  大家都是踮著腳後跟在走路，



  沒人說話，



  也沒人發出其他聲音，



  只剩下偶爾傳出的「擦擦擦」鞋底摩擦聲響。



  周澤也在跟著所有人一起麻木地前行著，他不時地在張望，也在不時地回首，他隱約間意識到自己來到了什麼地方。 



  他，已經死了；



  而這裡，



  是地獄。



  這裡，是死者的世界，是亡者的歸宿，



  自己，



  終究還是死了。



  他不知道該怎麼辦，也不知道該做出何種選擇，



  他不想死，人，都是不想死的，但在這個地方，他完全不知道自己又該如何是好，他很迷茫，也很無助。



  「咿呀……………………………………」



  清冷的小調自遠處傳來，



  周澤撇過頭，看見遠處走來一朵朵的鮮紅，而周圍其他人對此都熟視無睹，繼續麻木地踮著自己的腳後跟往前走去。



  等近了之後，周澤看清楚了，那一朵朵鮮紅是一把把桃花紙傘，遠處，有一群女人，排著一條隊伍，撐著紙傘，婀娜走來。



  她們身材高挑，體格風、、、騷，全都穿著紫色的旗袍，走動間，大腿的肉色不時露出，隱約的魅惑，讓人心悸。



  女人們盤著髮髻，一絲不苟，甚至連她們的步履，都整整齊齊，仿佛世間最優秀的歌舞團，而且，她們已經排練了超過百年。



  她們在走，



  她們在行進， 



  從小徑的一端，走向另一端，



  無巧不巧地，



  自周澤面前經過。



  精緻的妝容，雪白的肌膚，那哼出來的清冷長調，營造出了一種煙雨朦朧的老上海氛圍。



  每個女人的手腕上，都戴著手鐲，顏色不一，大小也不同，襯托著她們的雪白皓腕，更令人目不暇接。



  可惜，



  她們不是行走在南大街商業步行區，



  也不是金碧輝煌的高端會所瓦台，



  她們腳踩著黃泉路，



  掠過的是彼岸花海，



  她們目不斜視，後者盯著前者，



  最前者，



  則目光空洞。



  當最後一個女人自周澤面前經過時，



  女人忽然側過頭，看向了周澤。



  原本世界最美麗，



  現在，



  直接跳轉到另一種極端。



  恐怖？



  當然恐怖！



  噁心？



  當然噁心！ 



  但周澤，已經是一個死人了，人會被嚇死，但鬼呢？



  女人看著周澤，



  周澤也在看著女人，



  二者目光短暫交匯，隨即，女人繼續往前走，身段搖曳，背影裊裊，旗袍的緊緻，將其秀美的身材勾勒得淋漓盡致。



  「你們……要去哪裡？」



  周澤下意識地跟著這一隊女人往前走，也就脫離了原本的隊伍。



  而小徑上木訥行走的人，



  卻沒有一個看向這裡，他們似乎不會思考，也沒有感知，而周澤，仿佛是其中的異類。



  一行女人，步步生煙，一直在往前走，呢喃哼調，似淒似冰；



  原本壓抑的環境，因為她們的出現，反而更讓人覺得蕭索。



  周澤繼續往前走著，他跟著她們。



  然後，周澤看見她們一個一個地走入了前面的水潭裡。



  水潭不大，



  宛如鏡面，



  她們的進入，似乎打破了這種平靜，吹開了一層層漣漪。



  最前面的幾個女人連頭都已經沒入了水面之中，後面的女人也在繼續跟著。



  周澤走到了水潭邊，他沒有跟著一起下去，他只是站在邊上看著。 



  這裡的一切，對於他來說都是一個絕對陌生的地方，任何人，一輩子，只有一次機會進來，而進來後，也就無法再出去了。



  潭水中央，有東西浮出，



  是一雙手，



  甲紅手白，



  纖細青蔥，



  兩隻手翩翩起舞，如夢似幻，讓人的視線瞬間被其吸引，再也無法挪動開。



  美，是吸引人的，而這種美，卻勾人心魄。



  周澤的眼眸里，慢慢地顯露出迷醉之色，甚至連自己已經情不自禁地開始往前走都不知道。



  先是腳面，



  緊接著是膝蓋，



  隨後腰部，



  到最終，



  水面沒入了脖子，



  乃至於，整個人都進入了潭水之中。



  潭水不冷，甚至很溫暖，水面清澈，能見度很高，當你進入這裡之後，你連窒息的痛苦感都沒有。



  周澤看見了先前那一隊撐著紙傘的女人，她們在水面之下依舊裊娜動人，還在繼續地往前走著。



  而距離自己最近的位置，



  則有一位身穿著紅衣的女人，她站在水下，但雙手卻在水面之上起舞翩飛。 



  周澤開始向這個紅色女人靠近，



  不是因為美色，



  也不是因為其他的虛妄影響，



  而是因為，這個女人身上仿佛有著一種說不清道不明的魔力，讓你靠近，讓你貼近，讓你情不自禁。



  終於，



  周澤靠近了她，



  而她的手，也慢慢地從水面上收了下來。



  女人頭髮很長，也很茂密，在水波之中飛舞蕩漾，讓人看不清楚她的臉。



  「終於…………又等到…………這樣子的人了…………」



  女人聲音清脆，甜甜的，糯糯的，



  迷人心酥。



  女人美麗的雙手伸出來，搭在了周澤的肩膀上，這動作，很是親昵。



  「你…………來陪我…………」



  下一刻，



  女人的頭髮開始飄散開，縷縷青絲開始吹拂在周澤的面龐；



  美人拂面，這似乎是很有情調的一件事，但接下來，女人的頭髮卻化作了世間最為堅韌的鋼索，開始捆綁周澤的脖子。



  「你來…………陪我…………」



  頭髮披散，不再遮掩， 



  女人的面容終於顯露出來，



  她沒有面容，



  她的臉，是平的，沒有波瀾，也沒有褶皺，這是一場很平滑的臉，足以讓萬千少女去嫉妒和羨慕，



  但她沒有鼻子，也沒有嘴巴，沒有眼睛，更沒有耳朵，



  無面……女。



  周澤感知到自己無法呼吸了，自己胸膛都快炸裂開來，同時，他的身體仿佛即將崩潰。



  無面女的笑聲依舊清脆空靈，但在此時的周澤耳中，卻像是魔音貫耳。



  周澤已經清醒過來，



  他不知道在這個地方被以這種方式糾纏住到底意味著什麼，



  但總之，



  不會是好結局。



  「你在這裡…………陪我…………！」



  無面女繼續笑著，頭髮亂舞。



  周澤下意識地伸出手，去抓住纏繞在自己脖頸位置的頭髮，他想要努力去將其掙脫。



  無面女對他自不量力的表現感到很是有趣，



  「你掙脫不了的，別掙扎了，能走到這裡來的，都有靈，有靈的人，我吞夠了，就有機會回去！



  你註定， 



  將成為，



  我的祭品！」



  但就在話音剛落的瞬間，



  無面女發出了一聲驚呼：「怎麼可能…………不可能…………」



  周澤的十指指甲開始慢慢地變長，漆黑通透的顏色，在這個水潭之中，閃爍著屬於它的異樣光輝，這個指甲的顏色，和周澤死前救治的那位老者指甲顏色一模一樣。



  「滋滋滋滋滋………………滋滋滋滋滋…………」



  熱水下油鍋的聲音傳來，



  無面女糾纏著周澤的頭髮在觸碰到周澤指甲時直接融化崩斷，而周澤的身形則開始慢慢地後退，開始脫離無面女的束縛。



  「不可能……不可能……這不可能…………為什麼！為什麼你也能離開！



  為什麼你也能離開我不能！



  為什麼！



  為什麼！



  這不公平！



  不公平！」



  無面女用手去攔住周澤，



  但當周澤用手去擺脫時，指甲一旦觸碰到無面的手，無面女原本完美無瑕的玉手當即被燙出一個洞。



  「啊啊啊啊！！！」 



  無面女發出了一聲慘叫，



  身形開始後退，自此，也失去了對周澤的掌控。



  周澤的身體開始上浮，



  即將浮出水面。



  「你跑不掉的……你會被……會被抓回來的！



  這裡，



  才是亡者的歸宿！



  你們，你和他們，哪怕是走了，也終究會被抓回來！」



  無面女在下方歇斯底里地吶喊咆哮著，



  她嫉妒，



  她羨慕，



  她瘋狂！！！



  而不斷上升中的周澤，



  則慢慢地失去了自己的意識，



  幽冥黃泉小路，



  彼岸花的炫目，



  無面女的咆哮，



  旗袍女的婉約，



  一切的一切，



  似乎都正在漸漸離他遠去…………

title: 第三章 贅婿
content:
On the midnight streets,

The streetlights were a dim yellow,

The people were anxious,

The sky was cold, and a wind that cut like a knife blew.

Zhou Ze also felt cold.

He didn't know where he was this time,

But he knew one thing,

This was... the human world.

He was already dead, but he had come back.

He didn't know what to do,

He could only mechanically and numbly keep walking forward.

He didn't have the time to think about many other things,

Like where he had just been,

Like the old man he had treated before his car accident,

Like the faceless woman in the red dress in the pond,

Like... his fingernails.

He had returned, which should have been a joyous occasion, but even when people occasionally walked past him, no matter how hard he tried to greet them, no one could see or hear him.

He was being rejected by this world, isolated.

Those who haven't experienced being put in "solitary confinement" won't understand the pain of complete isolation, and for Zhou Ze, the entire world was his cage, with a black cloth thrown over it.

No one could see him,

And no one could communicate with him.

He couldn't pick up anything substantial,

Even,

The wind could easily blow through him.

He was so weak,

The phrase "weak as a reed" was truly not an exaggeration for him.

Moreover, what shocked and horrified Zhou Ze the most was,

He could see faint light spots continuously dissipating from his body,

In other words,

His body was slowly fading away.

Perhaps in another fifteen minutes, he would completely disappear, with the last trace of him wiped away.

He didn't know how all this was happening, but he knew that his time was truly running out.

Among the Eight Immortals, Tieguai Li entered the body of a starving person to become the figure passed down through generations.

Zhou Ze had also heard stories of ghosts "borrowing a corpse to return to life," and he also wanted to borrow a corpse to return to life. He was very cold and panicked, and he needed a physical body to attach himself to.

He didn't even care who the person was.

People are always selfish at times like these, and Zhou Ze was no exception, and he truly couldn't take it anymore.

However, every time he prepared to approach someone, light and fire would appear at the person's head and shoulders, preventing him from getting close, and he was even harmed, accelerating his "evaporation."

He was tired, and somewhat numb,

He was waiting for his end,

Waiting for his conclusion.

As someone who had already died once, facing death again made him a bit more composed.

Moreover, in Zhou Ze's current situation, the longer he stayed here, the longer he would endure the torment.

"Creak..."

Ahead, there was a shop still lit up; it looked like a bookstore, as rows of bookshelves could be seen through the glass door.

Someone opened the door and came out. It was a man in a hoodie, wearing a cap, so his face couldn't be seen clearly. He looked around a bit and then left in a hurry.

Of course, the man couldn't see Zhou Ze, who was standing less than five meters away.

Originally, Zhou Ze didn't feel anything unusual, but shortly after the man left, Zhou Ze suddenly sensed a warm aura from inside the bookstore.

Yes,

A warm aura.

This warmth was inexplicable to Zhou Ze, but he was like a freezing person who suddenly found a box of matches; even if he knew the matches wouldn't save his life, he would still strike one to feel the last warmth before dying.

Zhou Ze walked towards it. His body directly passed through the bookstore's glass door and continued inside, arriving behind the bookshelves.

Behind the bookshelves,

Lay a person,

A handsome young man, perhaps around twenty-three or twenty-four years old. Because the store had air conditioning, he wasn't wearing many clothes, just a long-sleeved shirt and a light jacket.

He was lying on the floor, but Zhou Ze sensed a warmth from him, like a poor man finding a bag of gold coins while walking on the road at night.

This attraction was irresistible, and Zhou Ze, in his current state, was not qualified to refuse!

Zhou Ze walked over and squatted in front of the young man.

He didn't know how to enter the other person's body, but he understood how to find the warmth he needed.

He reached out a hand and placed it on the other person's chest.

Zhou Ze saw his fingernails slowly embed themselves into the other person's flesh.

It was a strange feeling, different from the "gentle breeze" that had blown through him on the street. This was a fusion, a merging through his fingernails as a medium.

Slowly, Zhou Ze began to enter the other person's body, and the two began to overlap.

...

"Xu Le! Wake up, wake up!"

Zhou Ze was woken by a shove, or rather, "disturbed." He opened his eyes and found himself sitting behind the bookstore counter, his hands previously resting on it.

"Hey, wake up!"

The woman's voice was sharp and high-pitched, with an air of command.

Looking up, Zhou Ze saw the woman in front of him; no, she should be called a girl, about high school age. Although a young lady, she still had a bit of childishness.

"Hey, Xu Le, what do you mean? You've gotten bold, haven't you? You want to give my parents and sister a hard time, right? How dare you not come home all night yesterday!

Who gave you the guts!"

Xu Le?

Who is that?

Zhou Ze spread his hands in confusion, finding them smooth. His own hands had calluses from practicing with surgical instruments for a long time, but these hands did not.

"Hey, I'm talking to you!"

The girl slapped the counter, looking furious.

Zhou Ze frowned slightly, stood up, and walked to the glass mirror by the store entrance. He saw his reflection: an unfamiliar face. No, he had seen this face before; it was the face he had seen last night.

This body,

Is it mine now?

"Hey, what do you mean? My parents are angry, and my mom is throwing a tantrum at home. I'm telling you, everything you eat, drink, and use now is from my family. What right do you have, as a live-in son-in-law, to put on airs in my house?

Who are you trying to impress!

If you dare not come home again tonight, believe me, I'll come over and slap you!"

The girl raised her hand as if to strike, but she suddenly realized that the man in front of her, her "brother-in-law," wasn't dodging and begging as usual. Instead, the look in his eyes made her feel a little scared.

At this moment, she checked the time and found it was already 7:30.

"Hmph, I'm going to school first. I'll settle with you tonight!"

The girl huffed and left angrily.

Zhou Ze slowly sat back in the chair behind the counter. There was an old laptop there, and a mobile phone next to it.

Even now, he still hadn't adapted to the process of his identity change.

He was Zhou Ze, a famous young surgeon in Tongcheng, and he was an orphan.

As a result,

He had now become this person.

What did that girl just say?

I am... a live-in son-in-law?

Have a wife?

And in-laws?

And judging by the attitude and tone of his "sister-in-law" speaking to his "brother-in-law" just now, his "live-in son-in-law" status really fit the good old traditions of ancient times.

A live-in son-in-law, commonly known as a "door-in-law," was not only looked down upon by his wife's family but also by everyone around him in ancient times; his status was almost the same as that of a criminal. During the Han and Tang dynasties, those forcibly sent to the border often included such sons-in-law.

He picked up the phone. It didn't have a password. Perhaps the guy was lazy or didn't dare to set one, but at least it allowed Zhou Ze to easily open his WeChat and QQ.

There were very few people in his QQ list: some junior high, high school, and university classmates. Then there was a "Family" list, with only one person, noted as "Wife."

He opened the chat history with her; it was empty.

Fine,

Zhou Ze opened WeChat and tried to search. He found a woman noted as "Wife." There were replies here, mostly Xu Le asking about things, like what to eat tonight, what to prepare for tonight, how much money was needed for inventory, how much the bookstore had sold recently, how was your health, and a whole lot more.

And her replies were often perfunctory and cold,

Using:

"Oh"

"Mhm"

"Okay"

to substitute.

Zhou Ze threw the phone aside. This social relationship was a bit complicated. He suddenly looked at his palm; his fingernails looked no different from those of ordinary people.

But the old man he had treated before the car accident, the escape from the faceless woman, and entering this guy's body – his fingernails had played a crucial role in all these events.

With a thought,

At this moment,

Zhou Ze noticed his fingernails slowly growing longer, and also becoming dark and translucent. There was even a faint black mist swirling around his fingernails.

"Hoo..."

He let out a long sigh,

Closed his eyes,

And when he opened them again,

His fingernails had returned to normal.

From morning until noon, Zhou Ze sat there, trying to adapt to his new identity and calm the discomfort caused by the identity change. He didn't even eat lunch, not sure if he forgot or simply didn't feel hungry.

This place was still Tongcheng. Zhou Ze's former home was in Chongchuan District, and now he was in Gangzha District, not far away.

By the afternoon, Zhou Ze sighed and slowly stood up. He would make the best of it.

He started trying to clean the bookshelves, at least to find something to do.

The old man who had choked him before his death had said, "He's been discovered," and the faceless woman in hell had said, "You'll be caught sooner or later," which made Zhou Ze feel a sense of crisis.

His current state was one of "barely surviving." Coming back from the dead was a stroke of luck, so he cherished it. At least, until he fully understood the situation and gathered enough clues, he had to fit into this identity, preferably without causing too much anomaly and attracting the attention of those "who wanted to catch him."

The business of this store was really bad. The decline of the traditional book market was not a new thing, and this place was not on the golden street right at the school gate.

It could only be said that "Xu Le's" choice to open a bookstore here was questionable, even for breaking even.

It wasn't until three in the afternoon that the first customer of the day walked in.

The customer was browsing the children's books section and had been there for a long time.

Zhou Ze waited for a while and then walked over to ask, "What subject are you choosing?"

Although, Zhou Ze didn't understand either.

"Just looking around," the other person replied.

"Mhm," Zhou Ze said nothing more. He hadn't yet integrated into the role of "bookstore owner."

But at this moment,

The person suddenly walked behind him and spoke in a low voice:

"You really don't recognize me?"

"What?" Zhou Ze asked.

"Last night, I hit you on the head with a baseball bat and robbed you.

And I even specifically tested it,

You clearly had no breath then."

title: 第四章 打工是不可能打工的
content:
Zhou Ze blinked, so the reason he was able to possess Xu Le's body last night was because Xu Le had just been killed?

Because the body was still warm, he could enter it?

Looking at it this way, he seemed to be quite lucky.

Without any aversion, anger, or panic about his identity being exposed, Zhou Ze turned around and looked at the man behind him, who was about his age.

The man blinked.

He saw something unusual in Zhou Ze's eyes.

It was joy,

It was relief,

And even,

A hint of admiration.

As a host, Zhou Ze knew what a difficult situation he was facing last night. If this guy hadn't happened to commit murder at that time, he might have been completely annihilated and would never see the sun today.

"Sorry, I fainted last night and felt very uncomfortable in my head this morning, like I was drunk. I forgot what happened yesterday," Zhou Ze explained casually.

He didn't think the other party would guess that he was a ghost possessing a body, unless the other party had water in their brain.

"You don't blame me?" The other party pointed to his nose, asking somewhat absurdly, "Even though I already told you that I hit you hard yesterday?"

"It's okay, I actually thank you for not taking my phone and computer from the table."

"That... I forgot." The man scratched his head. "I'm glad you're okay. This is the money I stole from you yesterday."

The man voluntarily took out 300 yuan from his pocket, then fumbled for more and took out another 800 yuan.

"800 yuan is for your medical expenses, and 300 yuan is what I stole yesterday," the man pursed his lips. "Yesterday, I lost my entire salary to the bookie gambling online. When I passed by your bookstore, I suddenly wanted some money, and after I knocked you down, I found you had no breath, and I was scared to death.

After running home, I couldn't sleep all night, thinking if the police would suddenly break in and arrest me for robbery and murder. I only took 300 yuan, and I felt so stupid, so worthless."

The man reached out and patted Zhou Ze's shoulder.

"Bro, I'm so glad you're not dead, really. I've been hanging around outside since this morning. I was waiting for someone to call the police, waiting for the police to come, and then I saw you were still in the bookstore.

You know, at that time, I was almost kneeling on the ground to kowtow to you. Thank you, you're tough and didn't die, otherwise I'd be finished. With so many cameras here, if you had died, I definitely wouldn't have escaped."

Zhou Ze looked at the 1,100 yuan in his hand and then at the "murderer" in front of him who was shedding tears and repenting. He felt that the scene was very strange.

To be honest, "Xu Le" was dead. Because he died, Zhou Ze could take over his body. And because Zhou Ze took over his body, the guy in front of him was spared from murder charges.

Both he and the guy in front of him benefited, only that poor Xu Le was unlucky.

"Okay, it's fine. Maybe I just had a bad breath last night," Zhou Ze moved the other person's hand away from his shoulder. He used to be an emergency doctor and had seen all sorts of filth. But in that extreme environment, he had developed some潔癖 (jié pí - obsessive-compulsive disorder regarding cleanliness). In fact, most emergency doctors have some degree of洁癖.

Precisely because he had seen too much dirt and filth, he cherished "cleanliness" even more.

"You really don't blame me?" The man asked with some joy.

"Yeah, I don't blame you," Zhou Ze nodded. "You should go back to work and live your life. Don't make mistakes next time."

"Okay, thank you, bro. You're a decent guy."

The man nodded heavily and left the bookstore to welcome his "new life."

Zhou Ze picked up his phone. He thought about it and decided he should still call the police, not to report that the man had killed him (Xu Le), but to report the man for suspected theft.

Let the police investigate. If the man really had a criminal record or had done other bad things and was caught by the police, then it would be his own fault.

Since he had taken over someone else's body, he had to do something for that unfortunate guy.

Although it was quite heartless and resembled the saying "having sons without a dick"¹ to report him by his real name, even after the other party sincerely apologized and returned his medical expenses, he still felt it was the right thing to do.

However, just as Zhou Ze dialed 110 and the voice from the other end just came through,

At the entrance of the shop,

The guy suddenly came back.

"One more thing..." As the other person walked in, he saw Zhou Ze holding his phone. He blinked and directly pointed at Zhou Ze, "You're still going to call the police, aren't you!"

Zhou Ze shook his head.

"Let me see your phone, give it to me!"

Zhou Ze could only shake his head again.

"You broke your promise, you son of a bitch, I'll kill you! Let's see if you die this time!"

The man instantly entered an excited and agitated state. He should have some mental issues, possibly due to his lifestyle as a gambler and his detachment from society. He often fell into extremes due to certain stimuli.

The other party lunged over, Zhou Ze put down his phone and started to retreat.

He was a doctor in his previous life, not a boxer, nor had he practiced martial arts. His body in this life was also a bit weak. When it came to fighting head-on, he was indeed a little flustered.

"Bang!"

The man slammed Zhou Ze against the wall and then began to tightly grip Zhou Ze's neck.

"I'll let you call the police, I'll let you call the police, I'll let you break your promise, fine, I'll let you die, really die. This time, I'll choke you to death and then bleed you, let's see if you die!"

The man roared through gritted teeth.

Poor bookstore, in the afternoon, there were no customers, and not even many pedestrians at the entrance.

His neck was almost numb, and he couldn't breathe. Zhou Ze struggled with all his might. During the struggle, Zhou Ze's fingernails suddenly turned black and grew longer.

Immediately after, Zhou Ze wrapped his arms around the man's back.

"Hiss..."

The man suddenly shivered, rolled his eyes, and immediately let go of Zhou Ze's neck. He stumbled back a few steps, knocked over a few bookshelves, and then collapsed to the ground with a thud.

Zhou Ze managed to escape and reached out to rub his neck. He wasn't too panicked before, after all, his fingernails could even harm ghosts in hell. Dealing with an ordinary person should be no problem, right?

But Zhou Ze hadn't fully understood the reason and use of these fingernails. He only knew that they were "infectious" from the old man he had saved before his car accident.

Indeed,

Having nail fungus, one infects two.

Walking forward, Zhou Ze squatted down and reached out to pat the man's face. Fortunately, he wasn't dead, he was still breathing. Zhou Ze shook his head, picked up his phone, and called the police again.

...

After finishing his statement at the police station, the police officer asked Zhou Ze to wait in the small hall because the matter Zhou Ze reported was a bit bizarre. He reported that the robber who had attacked him but was knocked out by him was actually the "murderer." And now this murderer was in the hospital, so they had to wait for him to wake up for further confirmation.

However, the police officer at least didn't handcuff Zhou Ze.

A middle-aged man was squatting next to Zhou Ze, his left hand handcuffed to the radiator.

"Bro, you're awesome. That guy was trying to rob you and you knocked him down?" The middle-aged man with a somewhat disheveled face rubbed his muddy bangs. "You've got that vibe from my youth. You have to beat these blind troublemakers to death!"

"Hey, you behave yourself," a young police officer walked over and reprimanded him. "This is your how many times stealing electric bikes since winter?

I say, it's almost the New Year, can't you be a little more settled? Or find a job and earn some money properly to send home? How old are you?"

"Working is impossible, never working in this life. I don't know how to do business, so stealing electric bike batteries is the only way to sustain my life. Going to the detention center feels like going home.

Everyone inside is talented, and they speak so nicely, I love it inside!"

"Hmph." The young police officer didn't want to deal with this guy anymore and turned away.

"Bro, how was my speech just now?" The greasy middle-aged man gave Zhou Ze a flirtatious glance.

"Quite interesting," Zhou Ze smiled.

"Che Guevara is my idol, Che Guevara, do you know who that is?"

Zhou Ze nodded.

"Let me tell you, this life has to be..." The greasy middle-aged man blinked and looked towards the entrance, saying, "Oh my god, so beautiful, is that a police officer?"

Zhou Ze turned his head to look. At the entrance, a woman wearing a blue down jacket and long leather boots was walking towards them with another female police officer.

"Should be a police officer," Zhou Ze said.

The woman was very beautiful, with a delicate figure and fair skin. Most importantly, the aura she exuded was the most attractive.

"But she's not wearing a police uniform," the greasy man retorted.

"Maybe she's plainclothes," Zhou Ze guessed.

"You're right, beautiful police flower, tsk tsk. Looks like I'll have to come in more often," the greasy middle-aged man smacked his lips, still looking unsatisfied. "If I could marry her, I'd be willing to lose ten years of my life."

Zhou Ze shook his head. He didn't dare to joke about lifespan or years of life anymore.

"You don't agree?" The greasy man saw Zhou Ze shake his head and said anxiously, "You're blind! A woman like this, losing ten years of life for one is definitely not a loss..."

At this moment, the female police officer and the woman in the long boots walked up to Zhou Ze.

"Xu Le, your wife is here to pick you up. The investigation over there is clear, and you're okay now," the female police officer said, pointing at Zhou Ze.

"..." Zhou Ze.

"..." The greasy middle-aged man.

---
¹ "有兒子沒屁眼的" (yǒu érzi méi pìyǎn) is a very crude and offensive curse in Chinese, literally meaning "have sons without an asshole," implying extreme misfortune or a lack of offspring. The translator opted for a more literal but still understandable interpretation of "heartless and unethical."

title: 第五章 陌生的夫妻
content:
"Officer, excuse me, what is my wife's name again?"

This thought only crossed his mind for a moment. Zhou Ze wasn't *that* foolish, but he genuinely didn't know his "wife's" real name. In this era, people rarely used their real names for their QQ or WeChat IDs.

The greasy man, however, cast a mournful glance at Zhou Ze. "Brother, you're not being honest. We agreed to be broken-winged angels for each other, remember?"

Zhou Ze returned the glance with a hint of helplessness. "I'm just as surprised."

The greasy man lowered his head, sighed, and murmured softly, "My dumplings are delicious."

"Let's go."

His "wife" said in a cool tone, then turned and walked directly towards the exit.

Zhou Ze had no choice but to follow.

She drove a Cayenne and got into the car.

Zhou Ze opened the car door and sat in the passenger seat.

To be honest,

It was a bit awkward.

If that unlucky fellow Xu Le's marital and family life had been more normal, he wouldn't be in such an awkward situation now. He could have found some excuse to explain to his beautiful wife's concern, like feeling dizzy and forgetting things.

But this woman clearly had the aura of an ice queen, seeming completely uninterested in him. Even fetching him from the police station felt like a mere formality.

"My dog ran away and was found by a security guard.

I'm just going to pick him up."

That was the feeling.

The woman started the car. She was quite young, probably around the same age as himself (Xu Le), and several years younger than the original Zhou Ze.

As the car merged onto the elevated highway, the woman finally broke the silence:

"Are you okay?"

"Oh, I'm fine," Zhou Ze replied.

Then,

Silence returned.

The woman thought her husband was being unusually quiet today but had no intention of probing for the reason.

Just then, the woman's phone rang. She pressed the speakerphone, and a voice came from the car's audio system:

"Dr. Lin, there's just been a school bus collision on Qingnian Middle Road. Injured individuals are already being transported to our hospital. The director wants you back immediately."

Zhou Ze was slightly startled.

So his wife was a doctor.

And also,

His wife's surname was "Lin."

"I know, I'll be right back." The woman hung up, exited the elevated highway, and made a sharp turn at the traffic light, heading towards the hospital.

She didn't ask Zhou Ze if he wanted to be dropped off at home first or if he wanted to get out and take a taxi back. Instead, she drove all the way into the Chongchuan District People's Hospital parking lot.

To be honest, Zhou Ze was genuinely worried she might ask him to get out and take a taxi home. He thought he'd have to shamelessly ask:

"Wife, where do we live again? I forgot."

He felt ridiculous just thinking about it.

The woman got out of the car, and Zhou Ze followed. The woman went into the hospital building and got into the elevator, and Zhou Ze followed into the elevator. The woman went into the women's locker room, and Zhou Ze...

Zhou Ze sat down on a bench in the hallway.

Just then, the first batch of accident victims arrived. One person was severely injured, and five children also sustained non-minor injuries.

Watching his "wife" change into a white coat and busily start treating patients,

Zhou Ze could only sit on the bench and stare blankly.

It felt a bit like a mother bringing her son to work, with the son just watching from the side, playing with himself.

However,

The hospital's characteristic smell of disinfectant and the stuffiness of the central air conditioning were somewhat nostalgic, a familiar feeling.

Ahead was the emergency room. The severely injured and critically ill patient appeared to be a girl.

It was a kindergarten school bus that had been involved in the accident. Seeing the children crying in pain on the operating table was indeed quite heart-wrenching.

Zhou Ze pursed his lips. Normally, at this time, he would have already changed and joined the treatment. He was the most famous young surgeon in Tongcheng, but now, he could only be an observer.

This feeling was very uncomfortable, but he had to endure it. Besides, this People's Hospital was considered the best hospital in Tongcheng, and the number and quality of doctors were beyond question. They should be able to handle it.

Soon, the next batch of children was brought in. They had less severe injuries and only needed wound treatment or simple bandaging.

Traffic police were stationed at the entrance of this floor. Parents who had been notified had already arrived and were very agitated. However, allowing parents in at this moment might disrupt the treatment process, so they could only be stopped for now.

Zhou Ze shook his head, stood up, and walked to the window at the far end of the corridor. He raised the window frame and took out a cigarette from his pocket. He smoked, and Xu Le also smoked, so it was convenient at this moment.

"Uncle, you can't smoke in the hospital."

Just as he put the cigarette tip in his mouth, a clear girlish voice came from behind Zhou Ze.

Zhou Ze turned around and saw a little girl in a lily-print dress standing behind him, pouting and looking at him indignantly.

Ahem,

This was a bit awkward.

Zhou Ze put away the cigarette. No matter what, being lectured by a little girl about public morality was somewhat embarrassing.

"Little friend, aren't you cold wearing so little?" Zhou Ze bent down and asked.

The little girl had delicate skin, a slightly chubby face, and big eyes. She was very cute, like a larger version of a Barbie doll.

"I'm not cold," the little girl shook her head. "Uncle, you can't smoke in the hospital anymore."

"I understand."

Zhou Ze nodded seriously.

"Are you okay?" Zhou Ze asked again.

"I'm fine. The other children are injured, and they are in pain."

The little girl turned sideways and looked at the children being bandaged behind her. Most of them were crying. It wasn't entirely due to unbearable pain, but rather, when one person cried, others would follow.

Nurses were not only treating wounds but also trying to comfort the children.

Outside, the parents, temporarily stopped by the traffic police, were arguing and cursing incessantly.

In short,

This floor gave a messy impression.

"Then you're really lucky," Zhou Ze exclaimed.

The little girl didn't even have a scratch on her.

"Mhm, I was sitting in the back row, so I'm fine," the little girl nodded, then voluntarily ran over to comfort her classmates. She looked here and there, encouraging and soothing them.

A sensible and strong child.

Zhou Ze turned around and subconsciously took out his cigarette again, but then put it back.

As he walked back to the bench to sit down, three nurses and two doctors came out of the emergency room.

One male doctor and one female doctor. The female doctor was his wife.

"It's okay, we did our best," the male doctor said, reaching out to pat Zhou Ze's wife's shoulder to comfort her.

As her husband,

Zhou Ze was sitting right there,

But he didn't dislike this scene...

The infuriating Xu Le had left him such a complicated mess: a live-in son-in-law, a very ill-tempered sister-in-law, and equally ill-tempered mother-in-law and father-in-law.

Zhou Ze wished his wife would just cheat on him, divorce him, and leave him in peace.

Anyone who had just been resurrected into a new body wouldn't want to bother with the myriad flavors of a modern urban gigolo life, would they?

However, what surprised Zhou Ze was that his wife actually reached out and blocked the doctor's outstretched hand, pointing at him directly and saying:

"This is my husband."

There was no tenderness or affection in her words. It was simple, blunt, like saying: "This is the husky we keep at home."

"Oh, hello, sir," the male doctor said, his expression a bit awkward. No matter what, trying to flirt with someone's wife in front of them always felt a little less confident.

Zhou Ze smiled and greeted him. It seemed his wife was very chaste... but he couldn't bring himself to be happy. It wasn't about jealousy of infidelity,

It was simply that life was better when it was simpler.

"I'll go check on the others. All the other children have been treated, and there shouldn't be any more issues. You two should go home and rest soon," the male doctor said and then walked away.

Dr. Lin sat down on the bench next to Zhou Ze. She took off her mask and gloves and threw them on the ground.

Zhou Ze saw that her eyes were a little red, her lips bitten between her teeth. Clearly, she was in a bad mood, which meant the severely injured child hadn't been saved.

She looked very pitiable in this state.

Zhou Ze somewhat understood Xu Le now. This live-in son-in-law at least earned more than his peers. His in-laws' financial situation was better than his, that was a prerequisite. And then there was this Dr. Lin, who was indeed very good-looking.

"Don't take it to heart. You'll experience much more in the future. Just seek peace of mind,"

Zhou Ze said comfortingly from the side, like a seasoned veteran. His experience far surpassed his "wife's," so his psychological resilience was naturally much stronger.

"Shut up."

The woman replied with those two words. If Zhou Ze had said this as his former senior self, it would indeed be advice.

But Zhou Ze was now Xu Le, and speaking like this in his appearance was purely speaking from a position of privilege, implying "it's easy for you to say."

"..." Zhou Ze shrugged his shoulders and inwardly despised Xu Le again. Look how timid he was, his wife dared to tell him to shut up directly in front of others.

Dr. Lin, with reddened eyes, slowly stood up. "I'm going to change. Let's go home."

"Okay," Zhou Ze nodded.

At this moment, two nurses pulled open the curtain of the emergency room, revealing the hospital bed inside. A small body lay on the bed, covered with a white sheet.

Zhou Ze's gaze swept over it. He had seen many deceased people. In his years of medical practice, he had saved many, but he had also seen many patients die helplessly before his eyes.

"Dr. Lin, this is your husband, right?" a young nurse asked playfully. They knew Dr. Lin was married, but unlike the boyfriends of other female doctors and nurses, Dr. Lin's husband had never shown up at the hospital.

One couldn't blame them for making a joke even in the face of death. It was like asking someone who posted on social media about their spiritual purification after visiting Tibet once to stay there for ten years; they wouldn't be able to handle it, it wasn't realistic.

"Yes," Dr. Lin nodded in response. By then, her emotions had somewhat calmed down.

"Then you two should hurry back. Maybe there's something planned when you get home, right?

I'm telling you, our Dr. Lin really likes children. You two should hurry home..."

"Damn it!"

"..." the young nurse.

Zhou Ze saw the edge of a lily-print skirt peeking out from under the white sheet. His mind went "boom," and he suddenly realized the uninjured little girl he had just seen...

She wasn't human!
